week3.practice3_html:
What it is

â€œEat More Good Fatsâ€ helps you nourish your scalp from the inside out by adding omegaâ€‘3â€‘rich foods and clean oils to your meals. These fats calm inflammation and improve follicle resilience so the baby hairs that started sprouting can grow strong and glossy.

Why this practice matters for you now

Karina, youâ€™re in the stabilization phase â€” shedding is calming, and new growth is visible. Because chronic stress is still humming in the background, your follicles need steady, antiâ€‘inflammatory support. This step is your big domino: by boosting omegaâ€‘3s now, you quiet stress signals that delay full regrowth and set the foundation for thicker strands in the months ahead.

Step-by-step implementation

  1. Stock the staples: Add a small jar of chia seeds, ground flaxseed, or walnuts to your pantry, and keep canned salmon, sardines, or mackerel on hand.
  2. Upgrade one meal a day: Stir a tablespoon of chia into your morning oats or yogurt, or top lunch salads with a serving of fatty fish twice a week.
  3. Check supplement freshness: If you use fish or algae oil, open a capsule and smell itâ€”any â€œfishyâ€ or metallic scent means itâ€™s oxidized; replace it with a fresh bottle stored in the fridge.

What to look for

  • Consistency builds momentum â€” one nourishing bite at a time. ğŸŒ±
